meanings.definition: A person who begets or brings into existence.
meanings.sent1: My genitor is my father, who helped create me.
meanings.sent2: The genitor of the baby bird is the mother bird.
meanings.sent3: The genitor of this delicious meal is the talented chef in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The genitor of the idea was the brilliant scientist who first proposed it.
meanings.sent5: The genitor of the beautiful painting is the artist who skillfully crafted it.

meanings.sent1: The genitor of the puppy is the dog that gave birth to it.
meanings.sent2: She knew her genitor was her biological mother.
meanings.sent3: The genitor of the apple tree is the seed that started it all.
meanings.sent4: The genitor of the new species was the parent organisms that mated.
meanings.sent5: The genitor of the family is the parent who started it all.

meanings.sent1: My genitor from long ago was a brave warrior.
meanings.sent2: The genitor of the royal family can be traced back to a king.
meanings.sent3: The genitor of this tradition dates back centuries.
meanings.sent4: The genitor of the family legacy was a wise elder.
meanings.sent5: The genitor of the ancient artifact was a skilled craftsman.
